Explanations about Options.-f(M):
Do full-format listing. This option can be combined with many other UNIX-style
 options to add additional columns. It also causes the command arguments to be
 printed. When used with -L, the NLWP (number of threads) and LWP (thread ID)
 columns will be added. See the c option, the format keyword args, and the format
 keyword comm.

Answers.MP Summary: report a snapshot of the current processes.

Explanations about Options.-l(M):
List signal names. This option has optional argument, which will convert signal
 number to signal name, or other way round.

Explanations about Options.-f(M):
The pattern is normally only matched against the process name. When -f is set, the
 full command line is used.

Explanations about Options.-P(C): You used "pgrep -P 6330" and the output was empty because there were no child processes. The solution to this exact problem is "pgrep -P 6330", but the rest of the question suggests maybe "child process IDs" are not what you really want.
Explanations about Options.-P(M): Only match processes whose parent process ID is listed.
